titleStmt.title: Fragments of a letter, pen trials and a protocol

msContents.summary: Recto contains the fragmentary middle part of a letter starting with the basmalla, followed by well-known opening blessings on the addressee ('May God increase your power'). The sender makes a request of the addressee ('God willing'). Preceding the basmalla some pen trials in the form of well-known blessings appear ('may God prolong your life and may He increase your power'). The verso contains two lines of blessings ('may God strengthen you and may He prolong your life') and also has traces of a protocol.

msItemStruct.note: Recto (perpendicular to fibres) contains fragments of 11 lines with a small blank margin at the top.
Verso (parallel to fibres) contains fragments of 2 lines and traces of a further 2 lines.
Held in the Special Collections Department of Bobst library of NYU and stored loose in acid-free file folders.

provenance.p: Purchased in Cairo in 1932 by classics professor Casper J. Kraemer, known as the "Cairo purchase."
